intro: Laserpitium siler, commonly known as siler, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Laserpitium siler is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
